meanings.definition: Not in harmony or keeping with the surroundings or other aspects of something; out of place.
meanings.sent1: The bright pink elephant looked incongruous in the gray forest.
meanings.sent2: The modern art piece seemed incongruous in the traditional museum.
meanings.sent3: The penguin wearing a top hat was quite incongruous at the beach.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful demeanor was incongruous with the somber occasion.
meanings.sent5: The loud music playing during the solemn ceremony was truly incongruous.

meanings.definition: Lacking in harmony or compatibility or appropriateness.
meanings.sent1: His incongruous outfit raised eyebrows at the formal event.
meanings.sent2: The mismatched furniture gave the room an incongruous look.
meanings.sent3: The cat trying to swim in the pool looked incongruous but adorable.
meanings.sent4: The decision to use a rock as a pillow felt incongruous but oddly comforting.
meanings.sent5: The silence in the bustling city was incongruous and eerie.
